<title level="1" right="Rules">[Cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=848)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 13</row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
You determine whether a character has cover. The rules for drawing lines found in the _Core Rulebook_ are useful in simple cases, but in more complicated situations, use your own discretion to make the call. Consider the details of the environment and 3-D space beyond what’s on the battle mat. For instance, hanging banners might give cover, or a PC who has climbed onto a ledge might have a clear shot at an enemy standing behind a short wall. Be generous to PCs who use creativity to get into smart positions, especially if they spend valuable actions to move or [Take Cover](/Actions.aspx?ID=90).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
